result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel A. Fischer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Joel A. Fischer
parties.address: 224 S. Second Street, c/o Taylor County Jail, Medford, WI 54451

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample.   The costs are to be added to defendant's current payment plan.

The jail sentence may be served with huber and good time.  The jail sentence shall begin immediately.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Consecutive to: Taylor County Case No. 15CF29.

Payment reminder letter to Defendant
Copy request by DOC
Letter to Defendant Re:  Unpaid Obligations

Defendant Joel A. Fischer in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Defendant Joel A. Fischer in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to count 2 - felony bail jumping.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court dismisses and read in Counts 1 and 3.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 2.  Court orders 3 months county jail with huber consecutive to any other sentence; court costs; DNA sample and surcharge.  - rt

for Joel A. Fischer
Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.
Initial Appearance on October 6, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.
Arrest Report

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $3000.00 signature bond with conditions of: Booking. Court ordered bond with conditions as requested and clerk to begin bond revocation proceedures on 15CF29.  Initial appearance set for October 6, 2015 at 1:00 p.m. ba
